page.title: 09Newhouse,Redlynch 2
page.content: Newhouse is open to the public and visitors will find an attractive house hidden from the road by woodland and a long drive.Parts of the house are being renovated. A number of rooms can be visited. As well as the Nelson memorabilia there is a selection of furniture from the 17th century and later, including a Breton chest and a Chinese table and cabinet.Nelson's sister embroidered some of the chairs.Paintings include family portraits and an interesting picture from around 1840 showing hares triumphing over man. One room houses a collection of costume and accessories from c1750 to c1930. In the stable block can be seen old domestic and agricultural implements.
